alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 11 at 2:20AM MST until January 11 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING THROUGH 6PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong to damaging winds will hit much of eastern New Mexico today and will combine with low humidity to bring more widespread critical conditions to the northeast plains and the east central plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 8 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and east central plains Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 13 to 19 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
